content.description: It's about 55 feet to the giant tree at the summit (the little one on the lip is not an anchor). The descent route is around the corner and an easy TR to set up and leaving that as the designation. Sketchy lead is possible, but don't assume you'll find a spot for those small wires (or waste much time trying).Â
content.protection: A rotten tree has slid out of the wide crack at the crux but not a lot of simple standard gear. The first piece, a wired hex (#3?) will hold weight and has held a fall, but is in a sketchy hourglass that works better as a lock and may not afford too many falls before blowing.
content.location: The obvious line left of Joad, and right of Flash in the Pan.

content.description: AKA "Joad's Army of Wild Mountain Children"Found on a scramble, slab with a decent crack now uncovered on it's second half.
content.protection: A poorly slung corner almost protects the slab start, but once at the tree there's a horizontal that takes an outward facing nuts and can be sewn up with TCU's that all survived a bounce test on the way down. A crack for the anchor has been uncovered that accepts 3 solid Camalot placements (Pink, Red, Gold).

content.description: The project here is going straight up the face right after the nice bouldery start, and again shooting left of the weak tree (rather than the exit to the corner and joining of the last moves of Seneca Ray).
Several stand-out boulders with 3 walls behind affording scramble, slab, crack, and face.
